intro: Arrabidaea lundellii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces showy, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes across the world.
